article_title: William A. Galston: The Recovery That Left Out Almost Everybody
article_text: If they were judging the economy by the monthly jobs report, working Americans would be popping champagne corks. Total employment has risen every month for more than four years. According to the Current Population Survey, more than eight million jobs have been created since the trough, while the number of unemployed has been cut by nearly six million. The unemployment rate has declined to 6.1% from 10%, and the number of Americans enduring long-term unemployment (27 weeks or more) has fallen to three million from 4.3 million in...

twitter.description: In The Wall Street Journal, William A. Galston writes that America's economy has not worked for average families since the Clinton administration ended.
twitter.title: The Recovery That Left Out Almost Everybody
